meanings.definition: The act of occupying completely or absorbing one's attention.
meanings.sent1: Her engrossment in the book was so intense that she lost track of time.
meanings.sent2: His engrossment in the movie was evident from the way he didn't notice anyone entering the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat's engrossment in chasing a laser pointer provided endless entertainment for the family.
meanings.sent4: The engrossment of the audience in the magician's performance was like a spell that couldn't be broken.
meanings.sent5: The engrossment of the students in the science experiment was palpable as they eagerly awaited the results.

meanings.definition: The state of being fully involved or immersed in something.
meanings.sent1: His engrossment in the video game was so deep that he didn't hear his mom calling him for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The engrossment of the children in building sandcastles on the beach was a joy to watch.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's engrossment in chasing its tail was both amusing and adorable.
meanings.sent4: The engrossment of the hikers in the breathtaking view from the mountaintop was like being in a dream.
meanings.sent5: The engrossment of the artist in painting the masterpiece was evident in every brushstroke.

meanings.definition: A legal document or instrument that is written in a formal and elaborate manner.
meanings.sent1: The engrossment of the contract was signed by both parties, finalizing the deal.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer presented the engrossment of the will to the family with solemnity.
meanings.sent3: The engrossment of the deed to the property was framed and displayed in the office.
meanings.sent4: The engrossment of the constitution was a symbol of the nation's unity and values.
meanings.sent5: The engrossment of the diploma was a proud moment for the graduate, marking years of hard work.
